author: Al Jazeera
title: ‚ÄòRefuse to fight‚Äô: Jewish, Arab activists call for peace in Israel‚Äôs Haifa | Israel War on Gaza News | Al Jazeera
text: In Pictures ‚ÄòRefuse to fight‚Äô: Jewish, Arab activists call for peace in Israel‚Äôs Haifa Israeli Jews and Palestinian Israelis come together to demand an end to the war on Gaza. Peace activists have taken part in a protest in Israel‚Äôs third-largest city, Haifa, demanding a ceasefire in the war on Gaza and the exchange of captives and prisoners between Hamas and Israel. ‚ÄúThis is the first time we are seeing this protest happen in the north,‚Äù said Al Jazeera‚Äôs Stefanie Dekker, reporting from Haifa on Saturday. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a protest with Israeli Jews and Palestinian Israelis, and it is significant because of the two coming together. ‚ÄúThe message here is to end the war and that they can only live peacefully side by side with a political solution for the Palestinians,‚Äù she said. Omri Evron, a member of the Communist Party of Israel, who helped organise the anti-war protest, spoke to Al Jazeera about the message the protesters were hoping to convey. ‚ÄúThe killing of thousands and thousands of Palestinians, the vast majority of whom are innocent civilians, is not only reprehensible, it does not serve the security of the people of Israel. It does not bring us security, it only ensures the next massacre, the next cycle of violence,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúCurrently, they [the protestors] are chanting ‚Äúrefuse to kill, refuse to fight, refuse to murder‚Äù ‚Äì this is our call.‚Äù Evron admitted there were difficulties in organising a protest of this kind. ‚ÄúIt has been difficult, not because there aren‚Äôt Jews and Arabs who want to come together who believe in a joint future of peace and equality and national liberation of both people in two states,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúIt has been difficult because the government and the police in particular have done everything in their power to prevent us from coming together, to prevent us from voicing a lawful and peaceful voice. We had to appeal to the Supreme Court of Justice just to allow us to come together and demonstrate.‚Äù Al Jazeera‚Äôs Dekker said the protesters were not allowed to march, and officials said the protest could not be held at night. But several hundred people were finally able to gather for two hours during the day.

organizations.name: gaza news | al jazeera in pictures

author: Rex Hodge
title: chevron-right
text: JACKSON COUNTY, N.C. (WLOS) ‚Äî A Jackson County campground saw big impacts from a powerful overnight storm. Residents believe it could have been a tornado. The white pines at the Trout Creek Campground near Glenville have very shallow root systems. Given high wind and some saturated ground, they can fall. That's what happened shortly after midnight, very early Thursday morning. When they fell, they didn‚Äôt, however, take direct hits on the campers. It was a close call though, and very fortunate since there were people inside them at the time. ‚ÄúNever seen anything like this before,‚Äù says Darryl Wiggins. He and his wife, Elaine, have been coming to the mountain campground for four years now, escaping the South Georgia heat. They didn't expect the severity of the overnight weather full of thunder and lightning. [GALLERY: CLEANUP UNDERWAY IN BARNARDSVILLE AFTER EXTENSIVE HAIL DAMAGE](https://wlos.com/news/local/barnardsville-hail-damage-extensive-cleanup-underway-buncombe-county-severe-weather-storm-western-north-carolina-gallery-photos) ‚ÄúThe twirling wind and then trees started falling,‚Äù Darryl says. ‚ÄúWe heard a crash,‚Äù says Elaine. ‚ÄúThis one fell right across the back of our camper, but it didn't damage the main part of the camper, just tore the luggage rack off the back of it,‚Äù says Darryl. ‚ÄúAnd put a hole in our awning,‚Äù says his wife. Their son was busy Thursday morning chain sawing the debris away. They‚Äôre all thankful no one was hurt and consider themselves lucky. The Wiggins believe it was a tornado. ‚ÄúI would say it was,‚Äù says Elaine. ‚ÄúI would say it was and probably didn't come as low. You‚Äôll see a lot of trees down there where the tops are snapped out, and that‚Äôs the reason I think it‚Äôs mainly a tornado,‚Äù says Darryl. One of the six trees that fell barely missed another camper. The resident wasn‚Äôt there at the time. The tree smashed the windshield of his vehicle. Jackson County EMS officials were on site Thursday to help assess the severity of the storm. Official word whether this was a tornado will come from the National Weather Service. ‚ÄúThey will send a survey crew out and check the area. But from what we're seeing it does look like maybe an EF-0 tornado has hit in this area,‚Äù says Jackson County EMS Director Todd Dillard. He says electricity remains out in the area. ‚ÄúPower, phones, there's some broken poles on up the road,‚Äù he says, adding it could be later this week before it‚Äôs back on. [EXTENDED OUTAGES PERSIST AS DUKE ENERGY BATTLES SEVERE STORM AFTERMATH IN WNC](https://wlos.com/news/local/duke-energy-restore-electricity-power-severe-storms-hit-western-north-carolina-may-8-hail-wind-thunderstorms-damage-trees-down-flooding) Nearby homes were damaged by the swirling wind. ‚ÄúSounded like a tunnel... a wind tunnel. I just heard a lot of snapping around us. That's when we started getting real worried,‚Äù says Louie Colon. He and his wife took cover between their bathroom and their bedroom and survived. He has a generator to keep the power on and gives a nod to their faith. ‚ÄúLord had his hand on all this,‚Äù says Colon. The Wiggins are also grateful. ‚ÄúWe are very thankful,‚Äù Elaine says.

author: Sof√≠a Loyo
title: Amigo de Daniel Bisogno pide oraciones; confirma gravedad de su salud
text:
Daniel Bisogno y su estado de salud sigue siendo delicado . El conductor se encuentra hospitalizado y en terapia intensiva tras sufrir una falla multiorg√°nica por una infecci√≥n en las v√≠as biliares.
‚ÄúEl Mu√±eco‚Äù fue sometido a un trasplante de h√≠gado el pasado mes de septiembre, sin embargo, tras lo complicado de su situaci√≥n cl√≠nica, se ha rumorado que ahora sufrir√≠a otro trasplante de h√≠gado y de los ri√±ones.
Hace unos d√≠as se vio a los conductores de Ventaneando acudir al hospital en el que se encuentra, lo que ha despertado las alarmas sobre su salud. Ahora, ha sido un amigo de Daniel Bisogno quien pidi√≥ oraciones para el tambi√©n actor.
Daniel Bisogno necesita oraciones, confirma amigo del conductor Alex Gou , productor y amigo de Daniel Bisogno dijo ante los medios de comunicaci√≥n que est√° preocupado por la crisis de salud a la que nuevamente se enfrenta el presentador, adem√°s, confes√≥ que el panorama es complicado y pidi√≥ al p√∫blico oraciones para √©l, pues lo considera uno de sus mejores amigos y una excelente persona.
‚ÄúEs de mis mejores amigos. Est√° grave, pero estable. Lo √∫nico que le deseo a Daniel son todos los rezos. Todo el amor que nos ha dado. Ha sido una excelente persona. Que Diosito decida lo que tenga que decidir‚Äù
Durante la conversaci√≥n, el productor de teatro confes√≥ que no ha tenido contacto con Daniel Bisogno desde hace dos semanas. Al preguntarle el motivo, simplemente revel√≥ que no se lo permit√≠an.
‚ÄúNo, no me dejan (visitarlo). Habl√© con √©l hace c√≥mo unos 15 d√≠as, pero recemos por nuestro Dani‚Äù , apunt√≥, sin decir m√°s sobre el asunto.
Cabe destacar que algunos miembros de Ventaneando como la conductora M√≥nica Casta√±eda , Pedro Sola, y la productora Iyari Gonz√°lez s√≠ han visitado a Daniel en el hospital.
üö® √öLTIMA HORA: Daniel Bisogno, en estado cr√≠tico, estar√≠a recibiendo esta semana un segundo trasplante de h√≠gado y otro de ri√±ones. üòî
Seg√∫n informaci√≥n de Kadri, el Comit√© de Trasplantes del Hospital √Ångeles aprob√≥ la cirug√≠a.
¬øC√≥mo consiguieron dos √≥rganos tan r√°pido?‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/mDuaILGqjL
‚Äî La T√≠a Sandra (@TuTiaSandra) February 19, 2025 ¬øCu√°l es el estado de salud de Daniel Bisogno? De acuerdo con informaci√≥n de Kadri Paparazzi , Daniel Bisogno necesitar√≠a nuevos trasplantes de h√≠gados y ri√±ones , pues los suyos ya no funcionan debido a la falla multiorg√°nica que sufri√≥ hace unos d√≠as.
Rumores indican que los especialistas y m√©dicos han evaluado la situaci√≥n, y considerar√≠an de nuevo este procedimiento pese a que hace apenas seis meses tuvo el trasplante de h√≠gado.
Daniel se habr√≠a sometido a diversos estudios, incluyendo un ecocardiograma y seis valoraciones m√©dicas, para autorizar los trasplantes, y supuestamente los nuevos √≥rganos llegar√≠an este fin de semana . Mientras tanto, el conductor de Ventaneando contin√∫a en terapia intensiva y bajo tratamiento de hemodi√°lisis para mantenerlo estable.
Veo que hay muchas dudas acerca del trasplante hepatico de Daniel Bisogno.
Yo no soy su m√©dico, pero si hubo inmediatez en su caso y habiendo una lista de espera de m√°s de 200 pacientes, lo m√°s seguro es que su trasplante fue de un DONADOR VIVO.
De hecho, aqu√≠ hay datos de‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/csefb71PZG
‚Äî Mr Doctor (@MrDoctorOficial) February 20, 2025

author: @nmas
title: Im√°genes Aurora Boreal M√©xico 2024: As√≠ Se Vio en Tijuana Fotos
text: Aurora Boreal se Vio desde M√©xico: As√≠ la Fotografiaron en Tijuana El fen√≥meno se debi√≥ a una tormenta solar que lleg√≥ al ambiente terrestre desde el jueves 10 de octubre N+ COMPARTE: La noche del 10 de octubre de 2024, una impactante aurora boreal causada por una tormenta solar sorprendi√≥ a pobladores del norte de M√©xico, quienes pudieron admirarla, fotografiarla y compartir diversas im√°genes a trav√©s de [redes sociales](https://www.nmas.com.mx/temas/redes-sociales/). Seg√∫n informaci√≥n del Laboratorio Nacional de Clima Espacial (LANCE), del Instituto de Geof√≠sica de la Universidad Nacional Aut√≥noma de M√©xico ([UNAM](https://www.nmas.com.mx/temas/unam/)), la tormenta solar se detect√≥ desde la noche del martes pasado y lleg√≥ al ambiente terrestre a las 09:00 horas de ayer. Incluso, el LANCE previ√≥ que el tr√°nsito de la tormenta se extienda hasta la ma√±ana de este viernes. Noticia relacionada: [Sorprende Aurora Boreal a Habitantes en Nuevo Le√≥n](https://www.nmas.com.mx/monterrey/sorprende-aurora-boreal-a-habitantes-en-nuevo-leon/) Fotograf√≠an aurora boreal desde Tijuana En redes sociales, usuarios compartieron im√°genes de la aurora boreal vista desde Tijuana, Baja California. La cuenta de Facebook Astrofot√≥grafos de Baja California expres√≥ que el poder observar la aurora boreal en la entidad es incre√≠ble debido a la latitud del estado, y destac√≥ que √©sta se debi√≥ la tormenta geomagn√©tica. En las fotos, captadas por Jonathan Cazares, se observ√≥ en el cielo los colores de la aurora, entre rosas y morados. Auroras polares De acuerdo con informaci√≥n de H√©ctor Javier Durand Manterola, experto de la UNAM, las auroras polares son fen√≥menos luminosos de la alta atm√≥sfera que ocurren por la entrada de part√≠culas de viento solar por las l√≠neas del campo magn√©tico terrestre. Eso ocasiona estimulaci√≥n en √°tomos y mol√©culas del aire, lo que produce luz durante el proceso. Adem√°s, el color de la luz que se observa depende del tipo de las part√≠culas que son estimuladas y de su altitud. As√≠, se observan los colores verde y rojo cuando se trata de ox√≠geno; rosa para nitr√≥geno y azul-morado para hidr√≥geno y helio. Se les llama auroras polares porque generalmente ocurren cerca de los polos magn√©ticos de la Tierra; a las que ocurren en los alrededores del polo norte se les llama ‚Äúauroras boreales‚Äù y a las que ocurren cerca del polo sur se les conoce como ‚Äúauroras australes‚Äù. Aurora polar vista desde el espacio exterior Cabe se√±alar que apenas hace unos d√≠as, el piloto y astronauta Matthew Dominick comparti√≥ una impresionante imagen de una aurora roja y verde captada desde el Dragon Endeavour, acoplado al frente de la Estaci√≥n Espacial Internacional. Peering out a Dragon Endeavor window that frames red and green aurora streaming by Dragon Freedom docked to the front of the International Space Station. ‚Äî Matthew Dominick (@dominickmatthew) When Crew-9 arrived I moved out of my crew quarters on the ISS to make room for[@AstroHague]. I now sleep in Dragon Endeavor‚Ä¶[pic.twitter.com/34XfeLXpcH][October 7, 2024] Tormenta solar Sobre la tormenta solar, el LANCE de la UNAM advirti√≥ en un comunicado que entre ayer y hoy podr√≠an ocurrir en el planeta alteraciones tecnol√≥gicas como da√±os en telecomunicaciones, sistemas de posicionamiento global (GPS), radiocomunicaciones y sistemas de distribuci√≥n de energ√≠a y de navegaci√≥n debido a la tormenta solar. Dijo que desde que se identific√≥, este evento se catalog√≥ como riesgo potencial para el clima espacial terrestre, debido a que sus caracter√≠sticas hacen posible que provoque actividad geomagn√©tica intensa o severa (G3 o G4) y perturbaciones ionosf√©ricas significativas. Seg√∫n el LANCE, ‚Äúlas tormentas geomagn√©ticas son alteraciones a nivel planetario del campo magn√©tico terrestre, y las perturbaciones ionosf√©ricas son alteraciones de la composici√≥n de la capa externa de la atm√≥sfera de la Tierra‚Äù. Destac√≥ que estos fen√≥menos no impactan directamente a la salud humana, pero pueden causar afectaciones en tecnolog√≠as. ‚òÄÔ∏èüåá La tormenta solar, ocurrida el 8 de octubre, de considerable magnitud ha alcanzado la Tierra, lo que ha generado preocupaci√≥n por sus posibles efectos sobre la infraestructura tecnol√≥gica global. El ‚Äî UNAM Global (@unamglobal)[#ExpertoUNAM]Pedro Corona explica. ‚¨áÔ∏è[https://t.co/PaNCrLkf7U][October 11, 2024] Historias recomendadas: [Tesla Presenta Taxi Sin Conductor y Promete Revolucionar el Transporte de Personas](https://www.nmas.com.mx/tecnologia/tesla-presenta-taxi-sin-conductor-y-promete-revolucionar-el-transporte-de-personas/)[Organizaci√≥n Japonesa Nihon Hidankyo Ganadora del Premio Nobel de la Paz 2024](https://www.nmas.com.mx/internacional/europa/organizacion-japonesa-nihon-hidankyo-ganadora-del-premio-nobel-de-la-paz-2024/)[Sobreviven en una Isla al Norte de Yucat√°n en Medio del Paso del Hurac√°n 'Milton'](https://www.nmas.com.mx/estados/sobreviven-en-una-isla-al-norte-de-yucatan-en-medio-del-paso-del-huracan-milton/) Con informaci√≥n de N+. spb

title: Astir Home Health Care Reinforces Its Dedication to Premier Home Health Care in Bloomfield, NJ | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Astir Home Health Care in Bloomfield, NJ, pledges to continue providing exceptional home health care, emphasizing personalized plans and the well-being of each client. Their dedicated team offers comprehensive services to ensure seniors live comfortably and with dignity at home. For more details, visit https://astirhc.com Bloomfield, NJ - Astir Home Health Care, a leading provider of home health care services, today announced its unwavering commitment to continue offering superior home health care in Bloomfield, NJ. Recognized for its dedication to quality and compassionate care, Astir Home Health Care ensures that families seeking home care in Bloomfield for their loved ones can access the support they need to live comfortably and with dignity in their homes. This ongoing service reflects the company's response to the growing demand for reliable, high-quality home care solutions in the region, emphasizing the importance of personalized care plans and the well-being of each individual.
‚ÄúAt Astir Home Health Care, we are deeply committed to the Bloomfield community. Our focus on providing exceptional home health care services is about more than just meeting the basic needs of our clients; it's about enriching their lives and offering peace of mind to their families,‚Äù said Cynthia Palmer, owner of Astir Home Health Care. ‚ÄúOur dedication to this mission is stronger than ever as we continue to adapt to the evolving needs of our community, ensuring that every individual and family we serve receives the personalized, compassionate care they deserve.‚Äù
Astir Home Health Care's approach to home health care is tailored to meet each client's unique needs, ranging from daily living assistance to more complex health care requirements. This personalized approach ensures that every client enjoys a higher quality of life, with services designed to foster independence, provide comfort, and enhance overall well-being.
Families in Bloomfield, NJ, looking for top-tier home health care services can rely on Astir Home Health Care for their loved ones' needs.
For more information about Astir Home Health Care and their home health care in Bloomfield, NJ , please visit their website at https://astirhc.com
About Astir Home Health Care:
Astir Home Health Care is a premier provider of home health care services in Bloomfield, NJ. With a reputation for excellence and a team of dedicated health care professionals, Astir Home Health Care offers a comprehensive range of services designed to meet the diverse needs of the elderly community. Committed to enhancing the lives of seniors and their families, Astir Home Health Care remains a leading choice for those seeking quality, compassionate care in the comfort of their own homes.

author: KIRO Newsradio staff
title: Newborn orca whale calf spotted, second may be coming soon
text:
Newborn orca whale calf spotted, second may be coming soon
Dec 28, 2023, 4:35 PM
(Photo courtesy of Maya Sears, NMFS Permit 27052, via the Center for Whale Research)
A new member of the endangered Southern Resident killer whale (orca) population has been spotted around Puget Sound, and a second may be on the way, researchers said.
The Center for Whale Research confirmed on its social media channels and on its website this week a new calf was spotted with the J pod on Tuesday swimming close to female whale J-40.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great! It‚Äôs always fun to have a new one,‚Äù said Dave Ellifrit, the orca survey lead with the center.
Puget Sound killer whale researchers Maya and Mark Sears reported the appearance and snapped photos of the calf. It is believed the whale is just a few days old and it is not yet known if it‚Äôs a boy or a girl.
More on orcas in WA:
Young orca calf spotted with pod of Southern Resident killer whales
‚ÄúI guess they had been out on (Dec. 23) and the calf wasn‚Äôt there so it‚Äôs very young. A couple of days old,‚Äù Ellifrit said.
The calf is sticking closely to the 19-year-old female whale J-40, so she‚Äôs likely its mother. Ellifrit pointed out that J-40‚Äôs calf is her first known baby.
‚ÄúFrom the pictures I‚Äôve seen, it looks like a healthy little calf. When they‚Äôre that young they‚Äôre always kind of lumpy and bumpy. They‚Äôll fill out over the next few weeks,‚Äù Ellifrit noted.
An unexpected birth, with another possibly coming
Ellifrit said the birth of the calf was a bit of a surprise.
‚ÄúShe wasn‚Äôt a whale that we were expecting to have a calf because she didn‚Äôt look noticeably pregnant the last time we got (a look at) the whales from the air, this fall.‚Äù
In fact, whale watchers had been keeping an eye on a different female.
‚ÄúJ-46 ‚Äî who‚Äôs a few years younger ‚Äî is the whale we were expecting to have a calf this winter,‚Äù Ellifrit said. ‚ÄúShe was looking pretty pregnant in mid-October, so if we‚Äôre lucky we might have a two-J-pod-calf winter.‚Äù
Two calves born in L pod during the summer
The center confirmed in July L pod members L-119 and L-94
each gave birth to a calf. At the time, the two calves were ‚Äúvery active and social‚Äù and neither showed any immediate signs of illness or abnormality.
Whale of a report:
2 new orca calves spotted in L pod
L-119‚Äôs calf is named L-126 and L-94‚Äôs is L-127. L-126 is L-119‚Äôs first calf, while L127 is L94‚Äôs third.
‚ÄúI mean, every single addition we can get to this population is huge,‚Äù Michael Weiss, the center‚Äôs research director said to KIRO Newsradio in July.
These were the first calves born in L pod since 2021. These are also the first calves born in the L12 subgroup since 2018.
That‚Äôs still only three ‚Äî with a possible fourth calf ‚Äî born in one year to the endangered group.
‚ÄúThe whales who should be having calves aren‚Äôt having them as often as a population that you would expect is well fed,‚Äù he says.
Survivorship from the last baby boom in 2015 wasn‚Äôt quite what researchers had hoped for, Brad Hanson, wildlife biologist for the
National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), said to The Seattle Times this week.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really, really good news,‚Äù Hanson
said of the new calf. ‚ÄúIt also comes with the trepidation of how they‚Äôre going to fare throughout the first few years of their life.‚Äù
More orca information
Unlike transient or ‚ÄúBigg‚Äôs‚Äù killer whales that dine on a variety of marine mammals, Southern Resident killer whales eat Chinook salmon almost exclusively, a fish whose numbers are also dwindling.
The whales may also be expanding the area they travel in the search for food. Researchers who monitor the endangered whales say the animals travel a wide range, with some spotted from southeast Alaska to Monterey Bay, California.
‚ÄúThey have a huge, huge area that they cover over the course of a year,‚Äù Weiss said.
How did Tokitae die?
Necropsy findings for beloved whale released
Researchers say underwater noise from vessels interferes with feeding, and pollution also takes a toll on the endangered whale population.
There are an estimated 75 Southern Residents killer whales, down from 98 in 1995.
Heather Bosch is an award-winning anchor and reporter on KIRO Newsradio. You can read more of her stories
here. Follow Heather X, formerly known as Twitter or .
Steve Coogan is the lead editor at MyNorthwest.
Contributing: Lisa Brooks, KIRO Newsradio

author: Goodwin
title: Year in Review: Top Deals in 2023
text: According to PWC, ‚Äú2023 was a reasonably strong year for the pharmaceutical and life sciences sector with both deal value and volume of M&A close to pre-pandemic levels.‚Äù Below is a recap of the top M&A deals in 2023 that focus on biologics and biosimilars and were covered on the Big Molecule Watch. In March, Coya Therapeutics, Inc. (‚ÄúCoya‚Äù), a biopharmaceutical company based in Houston, announced a worldwide agreement with Dr. Reddy‚Äôs Laboratories Ltd. (‚ÄúDr. Reddy‚Äôs‚Äù) to license Dr. Reddy‚Äôs proposed biosimilar abatacept for the development and commercialization of COYA 302 for the treatment of neurodegenerative conditions. Under the agreement, Coya in-licensed Dr. Reddy‚Äôs proposed abatacept biosimilar and obtained exclusive rights to develop and commercialize COYA 302 across multiple neurodegenerative diseases in multiple territories, including in North and South America, the EU, United Kingdom, and Japan. Dr. Reddy‚Äôs will have exclusive rights to the same in areas outside of these territories. Coya later reported its 48-week clinical data for a proof-of-concept open-label study in 4 patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) demonstrating that treatment with COYA 302 appeared to ameliorate disease progression. In October, Coya reported new data supporting the mechanism of action of COYA 302 for the treatment of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (‚ÄúALS‚Äù) at the 22nd Annual Northeast ALS Consortium Meeting. In September, Meitheal, a biopharmaceutical company based in Chicago, entered into an exclusive licensing deal with Tonghua Dongbao Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (‚ÄúTHDB‚Äù) to market three biosimilars of the top selling branded insulins in the United States ‚Äì asprat, lispro and glargine. All are expected to begin clinical trials in 2024. The agreement granted Meitheal and its parent company, Nanjing King-Friend Biochemical Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (‚ÄúNKF‚Äù), exclusive rights to commercialize the three biosimilar insulin products upon approval by the FDA, estimated to be on or around 2026. THDB and NKF will jointly handle product development and supply. In January, Coherus BioSciences, Inc. (‚ÄúCoherus‚Äù) announced the execution of a binding term sheet with Klinge Biopharma GmbH (‚ÄúKlinge Biopharma‚Äù) for the exclusive commercialization rights to FYB203, Formycon AG‚Äôs (‚ÄúFormycon‚Äù) biosimilar candidate to EYLEA (aflibercept), in the United States. Under the binding term sheet, Coherus will make a total upfront payment to Klinge of approximately ‚Ç¨30 million, comprised of cash and Coherus common stock, thirty days after the execution of the definitive agreements. Coherus will also make other regulatory and launch milestone payments and share profits approximately equally with Klinge in consideration for the commercialization rights to FYB203 in the United States. Formycon AG is entitled to participate in all Klinge income under the agreement with Coherus in the mid-single to low-double-digit-percentage range. Coherus intends to launch the product at EYLEA biosimilar market formation, currently expected to be in 2025, if approved. In January, Alteogen, Inc. (‚ÄúAlteogen‚Äù) announced that it entered an exclusive license agreement with Sandoz AG (‚ÄúSandoz‚Äù) pursuant to which Sandoz will have worldwide rights to use Alteogen‚Äôs ALT-B4 hyaluronidase, derived using HYBROZYME Technology, to develop and commercialize a subcutaneous version of a Sandoz biosimilar product. Sandoz also has an option to license the HYBROZYME Technology for two other products. Under the agreement, Alteogen received an upfront payment and is eligible to receive milestone payments upon Sandoz‚Äô achievement of specified development, regulatory and sales milestones. Alteogen will be entitled to receive tiered royalties ranging from mid-single digit to low-double digit on sales of the commercialized product. Alteogen will be responsible for regulatory development and commercial supply of ALT-B4 to Sandoz. For the two option products under this agreement, Alteogen and Sandoz will negotiate separate agreements at the time of exercising each option. The agreement allows for both companies to collaborate on the development and commercialization of additional products that Sandoz may undertake to develop. In June, Coherus announced that it has entered into a definitive merger agreement with Surface Oncology, Inc. (‚ÄúSurface Oncology‚Äù), where, at the closing, Coherus will acquire Surface Oncology, a clinical-stage immuno-oncology (‚ÄúI-O‚Äù) company developing next-generation immunotherapies that target the tumor microenvironment. Coherus noted that this acquisition adds two differentiated clinical stage assets to Coherus‚Äô novel I-O pipeline: SRF388, a novel IL-27-targeted antibody currently being evaluated in Phase 2 clinical trials in lung cancer and liver cancer, and SFR114, a CCR8-targeted antibody currently in a Phase 1/2 study as a monotherapy in patients with advanced solid tumors. There was reported a stock for stock transaction valued at up to $65 million and an approximate three-fold premium over Surface‚Äôs anticipated net cash of $20 to $25 million at closing. Surface shareholders will also receive CVRs based on potential future payments for previously partnered assets and for potential ex-US licensing.
